parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or party affiliation.  The content focuses on encouraging informed voting in general, not endorsing a particular candidate.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its message ("Don't leave the elections to chance!") is clearly intended for a broad audience, not a specific individual or small group.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. While the post relates to the electoral process, its objective is not to directly influence the vote for a specific candidate. Instead, it aims to encourage voter participation and informed decision-making. The website linked (eucucinevotez.eu) suggests a tool for comparing candidates' platforms, promoting informed choices rather than advocating for a particular outcome.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post's content and style align with citizen journalism or public service announcements. It provides information and encourages engagement with the electoral process without explicitly endorsing any candidate or party. The involvement of organizations like Konrad-Adenauer-Stiftung further supports this interpretation.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post doesn't express a personal opinion; it promotes civic engagement.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1109396610785375</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while related to the electoral process, does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The post encourages informed voting but doesn't advocate for or against any specific candidate or party.  Its aim is to promote civic participation, aligning with the allowed categories of educational and journalistic content related to the electoral process. The involvement of reputable organizations like Konrad-Adenauer-Stiftung further strengthens this interpretation.  The post does not violate Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006 because it lacks the direct reference to a candidate (a), its objective is not to directly influence votes for a specific candidate (c), and it remains within the boundaries of journalistic information (d).
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>DifinePR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
